sub_title: PhD Candidate at TiSEM | Interdisciplinary researcher | CIPT, CIPP/E | Designing software that improves lives.
summary:
Working to bring design thinking to privacy regulation and compliance. 

Always curious and multi-disciplinary, I have a background in Law & Economics and Requirements Driven Design Science, but I am also a self-taught software engineer. My technical knowledge helps me understand how IT works while my experience in law and economics help me understand its context, and my people skills help me bridge the communication gap between the fields. 

In my day job, I work with the design and coding of legal and technical infrastructure in the context of shifting technological, social and regulatory environments. More specifically, I am currently working on designing user-focused Privacy Enhancing Tools for cookie consent management using inputs from law, game theory and behavioural economics, and requirements-driven design science. 

In my free time, I like to fly planes, write stories and read Sir Terry Pratchett's work. Feel free to reach out for a chat!
